requirements.summary: Add an explicit name-claim step to first-time profile setup and surface name-claim status in the authenticated UI using plain-English copy.
acceptanceCriteria: During first-time profile setup, the user must complete an explicit name-claim step (e.g., checkbox + short statement) before profile creation can be submitted.
Backend persists additional profile metadata needed for name-claim/verification status (e.g., a claimed-name confirmation flag and any supporting fields added by this change).

Backend enforces at least one concrete anti-impersonation rule at write time (for example: claimed display name uniqueness across all users, or preventing claimed-name changes after initial creation), returning a clear error message when violated.
UI surfaces the user’s current name-claim/verification status in the authenticated area (e.g., in the profile section) in plain English.
No user-facing text in this flow uses crypto terminology (e.g., “mint”, “token”, “coin”, “wallet”, “moon”, “pump”, “airdrops”).

file_operations.description: Extend the frontend UserProfile type to include name-claim metadata fields required to render name-claim status (e.g., a boolean confirmation flag and any supporting fields).

Add an explicit name-claim step (checkbox + short statement input) that must be completed before submit; include inline validation and display backend error messages in a user-friendly way; ensure all copy is plain English and avoids crypto terms.
Surface the user’s current name-claim status in the profile section (plain-English labels such as confirmed/unconfirmed) and ensure the status renders safely when older profiles lack the new fields.

Keep profile-setup gating behavior consistent after adding new required fields (avoid modal flash and ensure first-time users cannot proceed without completing the updated setup). Use the selected "authorization" component guidance for profile setup gating patterns; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Remove the automatic “_COIN” suffix from all frontend symbol construction and displays, using only the person’s identifier everywhere.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend no longer creates or looks up per-user asset symbols using the “_COIN” suffix (e.g., `username.concat("_COIN")` is removed and replaced with the new naming rule).
Frontend no longer constructs symbols with `_${...}_COIN` (e.g., dashboard and profile setup helper text are updated accordingly).
Any UI labels/badges that previously showed `username_COI​N` now show the updated identifier.
Newly created users receive balances under the new naming rule without errors when loading their dashboard balances.

file_operations.description: Add a small utility to consistently derive the per-user asset identifier from a username using the new naming rule (no “_COIN” suffix), so all UI/hook callsites share one source of truth.
Replace `${userProfile.username}_COIN` symbol construction with the shared asset identifier utility and update any displayed identifier badges accordingly.
Remove or update any helper text that previously described an “_COIN” suffix; ensure any identifier preview reflects the new naming rule (no suffix).

requirements.summary: Replace crypto-like wording across key screens with plain-English, non-crypto terminology while keeping functionality unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page copy is updated to remove crypto jargon and crypto tropes (examples currently present include: “meme exchange”, “tradeable asset”, “Mint your personal coin”, “moon”, “pump”, “wallet”).

Profile setup modal copy is updated to remove crypto jargon (examples currently present include: “mint your personal coin”, “Your coin symbol will be …”, and the submit CTA “Create Profile & Mint Coin”).
Dashboard page copy is updated to remove crypto jargon (examples currently present include: “Your Coin”, “Your Coin Symbol”).
Coin detail page copy is updated to remove crypto jargon (examples currently present include: “Friend Coin”, “Trade this friend-stock”).
All replacements are in English and keep the underlying functionality unchanged (orders/balances still work), only the terminology changes.

file_operations.description: Update marketing/landing copy to remove crypto jargon/tropes (e.g., remove references to minting, coins, moon/pump, wallets) and replace with plain-English descriptions of the product without changing navigation/login behavior.
Update all profile setup copy and CTAs to avoid crypto terminology (including removing 'mint'/'coin' language) while preserving the same profile creation behavior.
Rename user-facing labels that reference coins/tokens/wallets to plain-English terms (e.g., 'Your identifier', 'Your balance') without changing balance fetching logic.
Update list page copy to avoid crypto terms (e.g., replace 'Friend Coins', 'mint your coin') with neutral language (e.g., 'People', 'profiles', 'identifiers') while keeping page structure unchanged.

Update detail/order book page labels and badges to avoid crypto jargon (e.g., replace 'Friend Coin' and 'Trade this friend-stock' with plain-English wording) while keeping order placement and order book functionality unchanged.
Scan and update any activity/market copy that uses crypto-like terms and replace with plain-English equivalents, keeping the page behavior unchanged.
